feature.name: daily wage calculator
feature.description: The daily wage calculator is a system component that automatically computes daily pay deductions for employees taking unpaid leave. It divides the employee's total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month to determine the daily pay rate. The calculator accounts for leave policy type (calendar days or working days) and automatically deducts public holidays from working day counts. Upon approval of an unpaid leave request, the system generates an automatic pay deduction that is reflected on the payroll table.

job_to_be_done.content: Calculate and deduct daily pay for employees taking unpaid leave by determining the appropriate salary reduction based on the number of working or calendar days in the month.

Provide a flexible and customizable method for calculating daily wages, including salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deductions, with options to select calculation bases and salary components.

To allow super admins to configure and customize leave encashment policies for end-of-service calculations, enabling control over which salary components are included and how daily wages are calculated for leave encashment purposes.
Calculate and manage unpaid leave deductions on a daily basis to be set off against the employee's monthly pay
To adjust and calculate an employee's salary proportionally based on the actual days worked, affecting their first salary and end-of-service settlement

primary_personas.content: HR personnel and payroll administrators responsible for managing employee leave and salary calculations.
Superadmin, Payroll table managers, and transaction processors who configure and manage daily wage calculations.
Super admins responsible for payroll and HR settings configuration.
Super Admins who configure leave policies and payroll settings
Super admin users who manage payroll configuration and salary proration settings

navigation_paths.content: Access the Daily Wage Calculator from Settings → Payroll → Daily Wage Calculation.
Access the Daily Wage Calculator by navigating to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure.
Settings → Leaves → Leave Policies → Add policy → Unpaid leave selection

prerequisites.content: An approved unpaid leave request must exist for the employee; the employee's salary information (basic and allowance components) must be configured in the system; the leave policy type (calendar days or working days) must be defined.
Company's public holiday calendar must be set up to accurately exclude weekends and public holidays when using the working days calculation base.
User must have super admin role to access and configure the Daily Wage Calculator settings.
Access to Leave Settings and ability to add or modify leave policies
Super admin role and access to payroll settings; existing payroll system with employee salary data

data_inputs_required.content: Employee's total salary amount (basic salary plus allowance), number of working days or calendar days in the month based on leave policy, public holidays falling in the month, approved unpaid leave days.
Selection of calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days) and selection of salary components to include (basic salary, basic salary plus allowances, or allowances only).

Selection of salary components (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), selection of calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and configuration of eligible leave types for encashment.
Selection of calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances) and day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days)
Selection of calculation basis: custom days, calendar days, or working days

outputs_results.content: Automatic pay deduction is created and reflected on the payroll table; calculated daily pay rate for unpaid leave deduction is generated.
Calculated daily wage rates that are applied to salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction calculations.
Customized leave encashment policy configuration that affects end-of-service calculations, with visibility into which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.
Configured unpaid leave deduction calculation method that applies daily deductions to monthly employee payroll
Updated salary calculations that proportionally adjust employee compensation based on selected calculation method; changes apply to all active unpaid amounts in the payroll table

procedures.content: Receive unpaid leave request; approve leave request; determine leave policy type (calendar days or working days); calculate total working days in the month; subtract public holidays from working days to arrive at actual working days; calculate daily pay by dividing salary amount (basic plus allowance) by actual working days; generate automatic payroll deduction.
Navigate to Settings, select Payroll, choose Daily Wage Calculation, select a calculation base (calendar days, working days, or custom days), and choose salary components to factor into calculations.

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > End of Service eligibility > Configure. 2. Select salary components applicable to leave encashments (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances). 3. Choose calculation method (calendar days, working days, or custom days). 4. Configure individual leave types for end-of-service calculations. 5. Review which eligible paid leave-type policies will be overwritten.

Navigate to Settings, select Leaves, go to Leave Policies, add a new policy, select Unpaid leave option, choose a calculation method (Basic Only or Basic + Allowances), and select a day calculation type (calendar days, working days, or custom days)

1. Navigate to Settings > Payroll > Daily wage calculation. 2. Select calculation basis (custom days, calendar days, or working days). 3. Save changes. 4. If payroll month is open with existing prorated salary transactions, reject those transactions and resave the proration settings to apply changes.

rules_limitations_constraints.content: Daily pay is calculated by dividing total salary (basic plus allowance) by the number of actual working days in the month. The leave policy can be based on calendar days (e.g., 30 days) or working days (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays falling in the month must be deducted from the working days count to determine actual working days used in the calculation.

Calculation can be based on calendar days (actual days in the month), working days (excluding weekends and public holidays), or custom days (company-defined, commonly 30 days in UAE and KSA to comply with labor law). The selected calculation base directly impacts salary proration, leave encashment, and unpaid leave deduction amounts.

Salary component selection is limited to two options: Basic Only or Basic + Allowances. Calculation method selection is limited to three options: calendar days, working days, or custom days. Leave encashment configuration applies specifically to end-of-service calculations.
Unpaid leave deductions must be calculated daily and set off against the employee's monthly pay; calculation method and day type must be selected when configuring the policy

Changes to salary proration affect all active (unpaid) amounts in the payroll table. When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions are submitted for one or multiple employees, Super admin must reject those transactions before saving new proration settings.

edge_cases_warnings.content: Public holidays must be carefully considered and subtracted from the total working days when calculating daily pay. For example, if 2 public holidays fall in a month with a 22-day working policy, the daily pay calculation must use 20 days instead of 22 days.

Calendar days vary by month (e.g., 31 days in January, 28 days in February), which affects daily wage calculations. Different calculation methods can produce significantly different wage amounts, so selection must align with company policy and applicable labor law.

Super admins should be aware that configuring leave encashment policies will overwrite existing eligible paid leave-type policies. The system provides visibility into which policies will be affected by the configuration changes.
Multiple options are available for daily rate calculation including Basic Only and Basic + Allowances, providing flexibility in how deductions are computed

When payroll month is open and prorated salary transactions exist, Super admin must manually reject and resave transactions to apply new salary proration settings; failure to do so may result in transactions using outdated proration calculations

feature_interactions_dependencies.content: The daily wage calculator interacts with the payroll system to automatically create and reflect pay deductions; it depends on the leave management system for approved unpaid leave requests and leave policy configuration; it requires integration with employee record systems to access salary information.

The Daily Wage Calculator directly impacts three main areas: Salary proration, Leave encashment, and Unpaid leave deduction. It interacts with the company's public holiday calendar and payroll settings.

The Daily Wage Calculator interacts with payroll settings, end-of-service calculations, and leave management systems to customize leave encashment policies that affect overall end-of-service settlement calculations.
Interacts with the payroll system to apply daily unpaid leave deductions to monthly employee pay; integrates with Leave Policies configuration
Interacts with Payroll system and affects active payroll table transactions; impacts employee first salary and end-of-service settlement calculations

glossary_terms.content: Daily pay: The calculated daily salary rate used for deducting unpaid leave, computed as total salary divided by actual working days. Actual working days: The number of working days in a month after deducting public holidays. Calendar days: A leave policy based on total calendar days in a month (e.g., 30 days). Working days: A leave policy based on business working days in a month (e.g., 22 days). Public holidays: Non-working days designated as holidays that are subtracted from working day counts.

Calendar days: the number of days in a given month. Working days: only business days counted, excluding weekends and public holidays set up on the company's public holiday calendar. Custom days: a company-defined calculation base that provides flexibility to align with company policies and labor law requirements.

Leave encashment: The conversion of accrued but unused leave into monetary compensation. End-of-service: The final settlement calculation when an employee leaves the organization. Daily Wage Calculator: A configuration tool for customizing leave encashment policies. Salary components: Elements of compensation (Basic, Allowances) used in calculations.

Unpaid leave: Leave taken by an employee without pay; Daily rate calculation: Method of computing deductions based on daily basis; Basic Only: Calculation method using base salary only; Basic + Allowances: Calculation method including base salary and allowances; Calendar days: Day calculation type counting all days; Working days: Day calculation type counting only working days; Custom days: Day calculation type with user-defined parameters

DWC (Daily Wage Calculator): System component for configuring salary proration. Salary proration: Proportional adjustment of employee salary based on actual days worked. Calculation bases: Methods for determining daily wage—custom days (user-defined), calendar days (all days in period), or working days (excluding weekends/holidays).
